title: Phonics and Word Families

vocab.definition: Words that have the same ending sound and letters, like cat, bat, hat
Words that end with the same sound
Letters that are not vowels: b, c, d, f, g, h, j, k, l, m, n, p, q, r, s, t, v, w, x, y, z
The letters a, e, i, o, u (and sometimes y)

teachingNotes: Use word family charts and rhyming games. Focus on common patterns like -at, -an, -in, -ot. Practice blending sounds.

sample.question: What word family do these words belong to: cat, bat, hat, rat?
What is a rhyme?
expectedAny: words that end with the same sound

sample.question: Give two words in the -ot family.
Are 'sit' and 'fit' in the same family?
How can word families help you read new words?
expectedAny: if you know one word, you can read similar words

truefalse.question: The words 'big' and 'pig' are in the same word family.
'Sun' and 'fun' are in the same family.
Vowels are a, e, i, o, u.
Word families can help with spelling.
Consonants are the letters that are not vowels.

multiplechoice.question: Which word belongs in the -an word family?
